alert.note: Alert for Kauai East; Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 30 at 3:59AM HST until January 30 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI... .A large northwest (310 degrees) swell peaked overnight and will slowly decline through today. Wind waves from fresh to strong northeasterly winds will combine with the northwest swell to produce very rough conditions, especially on Kauai and Oahu through today as well. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 14 to 18 feet along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai, and 12 to 16 feet along north facing shores of Maui. Surf of 10 to 14 feet along west facing shores of Kauai and 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Oahu. Surf of 7 to 10 feet along east facing shores of Kauai. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai as well as north facing shores of Maui and east facing shores of Kauai. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
